prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night, I was up at the top of Mt. Poniponi, the mountain next to the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: I hate crowds, so I climbed up there to pray in peace
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: I know it's a no-no, but since there was no one around...
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: ...I used my binoculars to spy on the rite at the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's when I saw the accused... stab the high priest with a dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I have a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find a pair that contradicts each other. 

First, I'll look at the characters involved. The main ones are Ahlbi Ur'gaid, Maya Fey, Ema Skye, Tahrust Inmee, Nahyuta Sahdmadhi, Rayfa Padma Khura'in, Puhray Zeh'lot, Datz Are'bal, and Beh'leeb Inmee. The victim is Tahrust Inmee, the high priest, who was killed during the Purification Rite.

Next, I'll examine the evidences. There's a newspaper from May 9th that mentions the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities. The Ritual Curtain and Bloodstained Letter suggest something happened during the rite. The Inner Sanctum Photo shows the high priest's body, shoveled snow, and a broken lantern. Maya's statement indicates the spring was already stained red when she arrived. Lady Kee'ra's Warning and the Warbaa'd Arrow near the high priest's home are significant. The Wanted Poster describes an escaped prisoner, which might be relevant.

Looking at the testimonies, the key one is from Ihmus, who claims to have seen the accused stab the high priest with a dagger while spying from Mt. Poniponi using binoculars. 

Now, I need to find an evidence that contradicts this testimony. The Inner Sanctum Photo (Evidence 7) shows the high priest's body and a broken lantern, but no mention of a dagger or the presence of Ihmus. However, the Bloodstained Letter (Evidence 5) and the Warbaa'd Arrow (Evidence 10) suggest the murder method might not involve a dagger as Ihmus testified. 

But the most direct contradiction comes from the Inner Sanctum Diagram (Evidence 15), which shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite. If Ihmus was spying from a distance, the diagram might not align with his testimony about the stabbing.

Thus, the contradiction lies between Ihmus's testimony of stabbing and the evidence that doesn't support such an act happening in the described manner.
</think>

{"evidence": 7, "testimony": 4}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's break it down step by step.

First, I'll look at the evidence provided. There's a lot to go through, but I need to focus on the key pieces. Evidence 4 is the "Ritual Curtain," which is described as isolating the sanctum from the outside world, and the entrance was shut during the rite. This suggests that the area was sealed off, and no one could have easily entered or exited during the ceremony.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 2 says that the figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night. Testimony 3 adds that the accused was seen reverse-gripping a dagger. 

So, the Ritual Curtain evidence indicates that the area was sealed, making it difficult for someone to enter or exit without being noticed. However, the testimony suggests that someone was indeed outside the sanctum, using the light of the full moon to create shadowy silhouettes. This implies that despite the ritual curtain, there was visibility from outside, contradicting the idea that the sanctum was completely isolated.

Therefore, the contradiction lies between the sealed Ritual Curtain (evidence 4) and the testimony that someone was outside, observing the events through shadows (testimony 2 and 3).
</think>

{"evidence": 4, "testimony": 2}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Alright, let's dive into this problem. I've been given a list of characters, evidence, and testimonies related to a case involving the death of a high priest during a Purification Rite in Khura'in. My task is to identify a pair where the evidence and testimony contradict each other.

First, I'll start by understanding the case. The high priest, Tahrust Inmee, was found dead during the Purification Rite, a significant ceremony in Khura'in. The evidence includes various items like the Rites Guide, newspaper, autopsy reports, and photos. The testimonies include statements from different individuals involved.

I need to look for an evidence and testimony that clash. For example, if a testimony claims the suspect was at a certain location, but the evidence shows they couldn't have been there, that's a contradiction.

Looking at the testimonies, Ihmus claims he wasn't at the Inner Sanctum and that it's impossible to climb the cliffs there. However, the Inner Sanctum Photo (Evidence 7) shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a broken wind guard on a lantern. If the ritual curtain was supposed to isolate the area, but the photo shows it was accessible, that contradicts Ihmus's testimony.

Another point is the Ritual Curtain (Evidence 4) described as isolating the sanctum, but if the photo shows an accessible area, that's a contradiction. Also, the newspaper (Evidence 2) mentions clear skies, but if the photo shows a broken wind guard, it might indicate someone was there, contradicting Ihmus's claim of impossibility.

So, the key contradiction is between Ihmus's testimony about the inaccessibility of the Inner Sanctum and the evidence showing that the area was indeed accessible, with signs of disturbance like the shoveled-out snow and broken lantern.

Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8

Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13

Evidence 14

Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15

Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)

Evidence 17

Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18

Evidence 19

Evidence 20

Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21

Evidence 22

Evidence 23

Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24

Evidence 25

Evidence 26

Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That evening, I was enjoying a trek through the night sky with my homemade paraglider.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: But just as Mt. Poniponi was drawing near, something terrible happened!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: An accident forced me to make an emergency landing at the Inner Sanctum!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: Gale force winds came out of nowhere, so I made an emergency landing at the sanctum!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: As I landed, I banged my head, causing me to lose my memory!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 5
Testimony: So you see, I ended up at the Inner Sanctum purely by accident!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's start by understanding the case. Ahlbi Ur'gaid is the guide, and Maya Fey is a spirit medium. The victim, Tahrust Inmee, was a high priest who was killed during the Purification Rite. The prosecutor, Nahyuta Sahdmadhi, is also a monk known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor." Rayfa Padma Khura'in is a priestess and crown princess with the ability to see the last moments of the dead. Puhray Zeh'lot is an apprentice priest, and Datz Are'bal is a suspicious character with a hidden face. Beh'leeb Inmee is the victim's widow, playing Lady Kee'ra in the rite.

Looking at the evidence, there's a newspaper from May 9th that mentions an escaped prisoner and weather conditions. The autopsy report shows the high priest died from a bladed weapon. The Ritual Curtain was supposed to isolate the sanctum, but the entrance was shut. Bloodstained Letter and Sanctum Prayer Flags were found. The Inner Sanctum Photo shows the high priest's body and a broken lantern. Maya's Statement mentions red water in the spring upon arrival. Lady Kee'ra's Warning is a warning to Abbot Inmee. Warbaa'd Arrow and Dagger are weapons found near the scene.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Ihmus claims he was paragliding, had an accident, and landed at the Inner Sanctum by accident, causing memory loss. He says he wasn't at the Inner Sanctum intentionally and that it was impossible to climb the cliffs due to loose rocks. However, the Inner Sanctum Photo (Evidence 7) shows that the sanctum had a shoveled-out area of snow and a broken lantern, indicating someone was there. Ihmus's testimony about not being at the Inner Sanctum contradicts the photo evidence showing his presence.

So, the contradiction is between Evidence 7 (Inner Sanctum Photo) showing Ihmus was at the scene and Testimony 3 where he claims he wasn't there intentionally. This inconsistency suggests Ihmus might be hiding something or that the photo provides proof of his presence despite his claims.

{"evidence": 7, "testimony": 3}
